content.description:
Start at the obvious vertical pillar at the far left of the wall.  After pulling over the pillar traverse up and right and meet up with Texas T.  Continue straight up and anchor off of screws.  Some fun stemming can be had in the last section.

Immediately across from the Petroforma building.
Nothing but screws.  V-threads are required for the descent.

This route starts out with some straight forward WI 3 climbing until you get to the vertical pillar.  This is where the fun starts.  The pillar is only supported at the top and bottom.  Make sure it is solid before climbing it.  Head straight up and to the top of the pillar.  This is definitely the crux section.

It is immediately across from the Petroforma building and goes straight up the obvious vertical pillar.  The pillar is not always in.
Nothing but screws.  Also, screws will be required for the anchor.  Rap off the route via V-threads.

A nice warm up route.  Climb through several bulges with plenty of good rest for placing pro.

Immediately across from the Petroforma building.
Nothing but screws.  Make an anchor with screws and descend via V-threads.  Occasionally there is a pillar on the right which you can sling the rope around for the descent.  Don't count on this though.

This spot is great for an after work ice climb.  Some ambient light is provided by the harbor.  If you leave work around 4PM you can have a top rope set before dark and get some good laps in via headlamp.
